H0.text: The name of which chemical element, with the symbol 'Rh', is derived from the Greek word for 'rose'. Rhodium

H1.text: The name of which chemical element, with the symbol 'Rh', is derived from the Greek word for 'rose'. Rhonium

H2.text: The name of which chemical element, with the symbol 'Rh', is derived from the Greek word for 'rose'. Rosium

H3.text: The name of which chemical element, with the symbol 'Rh', is derived from the Greek word for 'rose'. Rodium

A4.text: Rhodium (from Greek: ῥόδον rhodon, meaning 'rose') was discovered in 1803 by William Hyde Wollaston

A5.text: It was discovered in 1803 by William Hyde Wollaston in one such ore, and named for the rose color of one of its chlorine compounds
